title: How to Make a Redstone Dispenser Loop in Minecraft

steps.title: Place a dispenser down, and a wooden pressure plate in front of it.
steps.content: Place a dispenser down, and a wooden pressure plate in front of it.

steps.title: Connect the dispenser and the pressure plate with redstone.
steps.content: Connect the dispenser and the pressure plate with redstone.

steps.title: Invert the signal by using a solid block with a torch on the other side or on top of the block with redstone going into it.
steps.content: Invert the signal by using a solid block with a torch on the other side or on top of the block with redstone going into it. As power comes in, the torch turns off, inverting the signal. Use the inverter on the redstone wire.

steps.title: Place a big stack of items in the dispenser.
steps.content: Place a big stack of items in the dispenser. Arrows do not work, as it flies over the pressure plate. Disconnect and reconnect the redstone wire to start it up. You will notice that as items hit the pressure plate, it sends a signal to the dispenser to drop more items onto the pressure plate.

steps.title: To use as a pulser, put 2 multiplied by how many times you want it to pulse of items into the dispenser, as two items are released on each pulse.
steps.content: To use as a pulser, put 2 multiplied by how many times you want it to pulse of items into the dispenser, as two items are released on each pulse.
